name: Cisco Spark Admin API - PUBLIC
description:
Spark for Developers includes administration APIs that allow administrators to programatically perform administration actions such as provisioning a user. By automating administration, user management and provisioning can be centralized in an existing tool, rather than using the Spark Administration interface. For example, a partner selling multiple Collaboration tools to customers can use these APIs to enable Spark provisioning through a centralized portal.

https://developer.ciscospark.com/admin-api.html


## What's possible with Admin APIs?

Currently, administration is focused on User Provisioning. Using these APIs, an admin can:

- Create a user
- Update a user
- View license usage of an organization
- View available roles of an organization


## Authentication

Use of these APIs requires you to be an administrator of an organization.

If you are an administrator, you can login here to get a development auth token with necessary scopes.

Creating an Integration that will act on behalf of an administrator can be done by including one or more of the following scopes when requesting an auth token via oAuth.

- spark-admin:people_read  Access to read your user's company directory
- spark-admin:people_write  Access to write to your user's company directory
- spark-admin:organizations_read  Access to write to your user's company directory
- spark-admin:roles_read  Access to read roles available in your user's organization
- spark-admin:licenses_read  Access to read licenses available in your user's organizations

folders.name: Events
folders.description:
Events are generated when actions take place within Cisco Spark, such as when someone creates or deletes a message. Use the Events API to retrieve events related to your account. Compliance Officers may retrieve events for all users within an organization. See the Compliance Guide for more information.
https://developer.ciscospark.com/docs/api/guides/compliance.html

The resource endpoints such as /rooms, /messages, /memberships, etc. represent the current state of data in Spark. The /events resource represents the log of state changes which led to the current state of these resources; it details when a resource changed and who made the change.

For example, when a user posts a message in a room, this will result in a new message, available via the /messages resource. It will also result in a new event, available on the /events resource. If the user then deletes their message, this will result in the message no longer being returned on the /messages resource but it will result in a new event for the message deletion on the /events resource.

Events are available for the following resources when they are created, updated, or deleted:
- messages
- memberships

https://developer.ciscospark.com/resource-events.html

folders.name: Licenses
folders.description:
An allowance for features and services that are provided to users on a Cisco Spark services subscription. Cisco and its partners manage the amount of licenses provided to administrators and users. This license resource can be accessed only by an admin.

https://developer.ciscospark.com/resource-licenses.html

folders.name: Metrics
folders.description:
Metrics reports are available via the API for organization administrators to gather and report on Spark usage within their organization. Reports are available for meeting and messaging activity, as well as call quality information.

https://developer.ciscospark.com/resource-metrics.html

folders.name: Organizations
folders.description:
A set of people in Cisco Spark. Organizations may manage other organizations or be managed themselves. This organizations resource can be accessed only by an admin.

https://developer.ciscospark.com/resource-organizations.html

folders.name: People
folders.description: People are registered users of the Spark application.

folders.name: Policies
folders.description:
Policies give organization administrators more control over the Integrations available for use within their organization. By default, any user can add an integration for use with Spark. To restrict the usage of integrations within an organization, create policies to define what is either allowed or disallowed by the organization.

Each policy contains an explicit action to either allow or deny access to external integrations. Policy options can specify which integrations, people, and/or authorization scopes it will apply to. These options may be combined to create very specific policies or omitted to cover a broader range of integrations.

https://developer.ciscospark.com/resource-policies.html

folders.name: Roles
folders.description:
A persona for an authenticated user, corresponding to a set of privileges within an organization. This roles resource can be accessed only by an admin.

https://developer.ciscospark.com/resource-roles.html

requests.name: Delete Policy
requests.description:
Deletes a policy by ID.

Specify the policy ID in the policyId URI parameter.

https://developer.ciscospark.com/endpoint-policies-policyId-delete.html

requests.name: Get Message Metrics (weekly)
requests.description:
This report will contain aggregate messaging data for an organization that is using Cisco Spark.

The data intervals specified in the query will change the reporting windows and time frame. This report will default to seven days of data (numberOfIntervals=7), with metrics grouped daily (intervalType=daily), if these two parameters are not specified.

Example Response:
``` json
{
  "items": [
    {
      "orgId": "Y2lzY29zcGFyazovL3VzL09SR0FOSVpBVElPTi9mNzlhMTE1Ni1hYzFjLTRhOTAtOWY4MC0zZDRjODc0ZWE1NTk",
      "averageActivePersonPerActiveRoom": 0,
      "averageActiveRoomsPerActivePerson": 0,
      "averageNumberOfMessagesSentPerActivePerson": 0,
      "averageNumberOfActiveDirectRoomsPerActivePerson": 0,
      "averageNumberOfActiveGroupRoomsPerActivePerson": 0,
      "avgNumberOfActivePeopleIn90thPercentileOfActiveRooms": 0,
      "averageNumberOfMessagesSentBy90thPercentileOfActivePeople": 0,
      "averageNumberOfContentSharedPerRoom": 0,
      "largestActiveRoomByNumberOfActivePeople": "Y2lzY29zcGFyazovL3VzL1JPT00vMDAwMDAwMDAtMDAwMC0wMDAwLTAwMDAtMDAwMDAwMDAwMDAw",
      "numberOfActiveDirectRooms": 0,
      "numberOfActiveGroupRooms": 0,
      "numberOfContentShared": 0,
      "numberOfFailedMessages": 0,
      "startDate": "2016-12-12T00:00:00.000Z",
      "totalActiveRooms": 0,
      "totalSizeOfContentSharedinMB": 0
    }
  ]
}
```

requests.name: Get Call List (for personId)
List Roles

tests["List roles: retreived with id:" + roleId] = true

requests.name: Get People Metrics (monthly)
requests.description:
This report will contain aggregate data for the people using Cisco Spark.

The data intervals specified in the query will change the reporting windows and time frame. This report will default to seven days of data (numberOfIntervals=7), with metrics grouped daily (intervalType=daily), if these two parameters are not specified.

Example Response:
``` json
{
  items": [
    {
      "orgId": "Y2lzY29zcGFyazovL3VzL09SR0FOSVpBVElPTi9mNzlhMTE1Ni1hYzFjLTRhOTAtOWY4MC0zZDRjODc0ZWE1NTk",
      "startDate": "2016-12-07T00:00:00.000Z",
      "numberOfPeopleThatCreatedRoom": 0,
      "numberOfPeopleThatFavoritedARoom": 0,
      "numberOfPeopleThatJoinedAMeeting": 0,
      "numberOfPeopleThatPlacedAMeeting": 0,
      "numberOfPeopleThatPlacedASparkucMeeting": 0,
      "numberOfPeopleThatPostedAMessage": 0,
      "numberOfPeopleThatReadAMessage": 0,
      "numberOfPeopleThatSharedContent": 0,
      "numberOfPeopleThatUpdatedRoom": 0,
      "unionOfAllPeopleWhoHaveDoneTheAbove": 0
    }
  ]
}
```

requests.name: Get License Details
requests.description:
Shows details for a license, by ID.

Specify the license ID in the licenseId parameter in the URI.

https://developer.ciscospark.com/endpoint-licenses-licenseId-get.html

Example Response:
``` json
{
  'id' : 'OTZhYmMyYWEtM2RjYy0xMWU1LWExNTItZmUzNDgxOWNkYzlh',
  'displayName' : 'Spark Calling',
  'totalUnits' : '42',
  'consumedUnits' : "8'
}
```

requests.name: Update Policy
requests.description:
Updates properties for a policy by ID.

Specify the policy ID in the policyId URI parameter.

https://developer.ciscospark.com/endpoint-policies-policyId-put.html

Example Request:
```json
{
  "appId" : "Y2lzY29zcGFyazovL3VzL1JPT00vYmJjZWIxYWQtNDNmMS0zYjU4LTkxNDctZjE0YmIwYzRkMTU0",
  "name" : "Allow App 123",
  "personIds" : [ "Y2lzY29zcGFyazovL3VzL1JPT00vYmJjZWIxYWQtNDNmMS0zYjU4LTkxNDctZjE0YmIwYzRkMTU0", "Y2lzY29zcGFyazovL3VzL1JPT00vYmJjZWIxYWQtNDNmMS0zYjU4LTkxNDctZjE0YmIwYzRkMTU0", "Y2lzY29zcGFyazovL3VzL0NBTExTLzU0MUFFMzBFLUUyQzUtNERENi04NTM4LTgzOTRDODYzM0I3MQo" ],
  "scopes" : [ "spark:messages_read", "spark:messages_write" ],
  "action" : "allow"
}
```

Example Response:
```json
{
  "id" : "Y2lzY29zcGFyazovL3VzL0NBTExTLzU0MUFFMzBFLUUyQzUtNERENi04NTM4LTgzOTRDODYzM0I3MQo",
  "appId" : "Y2lzY29zcGFyazovL3VzL1JPT00vYmJjZWIxYWQtNDNmMS0zYjU4LTkxNDctZjE0YmIwYzRkMTU0",
  "name" : "Allow App 123",
  "personIds" : [ "Y2lzY29zcGFyazovL3VzL1JPT00vYmJjZWIxYWQtNDNmMS0zYjU4LTkxNDctZjE0YmIwYzRkMTU0", "Y2lzY29zcGFyazovL3VzL1JPT00vYmJjZWIxYWQtNDNmMS0zYjU4LTkxNDctZjE0YmIwYzRkMTU0", "Y2lzY29zcGFyazovL3VzL0NBTExTLzU0MUFFMzBFLUUyQzUtNERENi04NTM4LTgzOTRDODYzM0I3MQo" ],
  "scopes" : [ "spark:messages_read", "spark:messages_write" ],
  "action" : "allow",
  "created" : "2017-05-10T19:39:27.970Z"
}
```

requests.name: Create a Person

https://developer.ciscospark.com/endpoint-people-post.html

Example Request:
``` json
{
  'emails' : [ 'johnny.chang@foomail.com', 'jchang@barmail.com' ],
  'displayName' : 'John Andersen',
  'firstName' : 'John',
  'lastName' : 'Andersen',
  'avatar' : 'https://1efa7a94ed21783e352-c62266528714497a17239ececf39e9e2.ssl.cf1.rackcdn.com/V1~54c844c89e678e5a7b16a306bc2897b9~wx29yGtlTpilEFlYzqPKag==~1600',

  'roles' : [ 'Y2lzY29zcGFyazovL3VzL1JPT00vOGNkYzQwYzQtZjA5ZS0zY2JhLThjMjYtZGQwZTcwYWRlY2Iy', 'Y2lzY29zcGFyazovL3VzL1BFT1BMRS9mMDZkNzFhNS0wODMzLTRmYTUtYTcyYS1jYzg5YjI1ZWVlMmX' ],

}

Example Response:
{
  'id' : 'Y2lzY29zcGFyazovL3VzL1BFT1BMRS9mNWIzNjE4Ny1jOGRkLTQ3MjctOGIyZi1mOWM0NDdmMjkwNDY',

  'displayName' : 'John Andersen',
  'firstName' : 'John',
  'lastName' : 'Andersen',
  'avatar' : 'https://1efa7a94ed21783e352-c62266528714497a17239ececf39e9e2.ssl.cf1.rackcdn.com/V1~54c844c89e678e5a7b16a306bc2897b9~wx29yGtlTpilEFlYzqPKag==~1600',
```

requests.name: List Policies
requests.description:
Lists all policies for an organization. Only lists policies for the organization in which the authenticated user belongs.

Use query parameters to filter the response.

https://developer.ciscospark.com/endpoint-policies-get.html

Example Response:
``` json
{
  "items" : [ {
    "id" : "Y2lzY29zcGFyazovL3VzL0NBTExTLzU0MUFFMzBFLUUyQzUtNERENi04NTM4LTgzOTRDODYzM0I3MQo",
    "appId" : "Y2lzY29zcGFyazovL3VzL1JPT00vYmJjZWIxYWQtNDNmMS0zYjU4LTkxNDctZjE0YmIwYzRkMTU0",
    "name" : "Allow App 123",
    "personIds" : [ "Y2lzY29zcGFyazovL3VzL1JPT00vYmJjZWIxYWQtNDNmMS0zYjU4LTkxNDctZjE0YmIwYzRkMTU0", "Y2lzY29zcGFyazovL3VzL1JPT00vYmJjZWIxYWQtNDNmMS0zYjU4LTkxNDctZjE0YmIwYzRkMTU0", "Y2lzY29zcGFyazovL3VzL0NBTExTLzU0MUFFMzBFLUUyQzUtNERENi04NTM4LTgzOTRDODYzM0I3MQo" ],
    "scopes" : [ "spark:messages_read", "spark:messages_write" ],
    "action" : "allow",
    "created" : "2017-05-10T19:39:27.970Z"
  } ]
}
```

requests.name: Get Person Details (me)
requests.description:
Shows details for a person, by ID.
Specify the person ID in the personId parameter in the URI.

https://developer.ciscospark.com/endpoint-people-personId-get.html

headers.description: The mime type of this content

responses.name: person details (Stève)
responses.requestObject: {"url":"https://api.ciscospark.com/v1/people/me","headers":[{"key":"Authorization","value":"Bearer {{spark_token}}","enabled":true},{"key":"Content-Type","value":"application/json","enabled":true,"description":"The mime type of this content"}],"data":"{\n    \"name\": \"European Football Championship 2016\"\n}","method":"GET","dataMode":"raw"}

exec: tests["Get my details: cannot retreive personId"] = false
tests["Get my details: retrieved personId:" + personId] = true
